Parents should help their children understand money. The best time to teach a child anything about money is when he shows an interest. You may start talking about money when your child shows an interest in buying things â€” candy or toys, for example.

Explain the basic function of money to your child by showing how money is traded for the thing he wants to have. If he wants a toy, give him the money and let him hand it to the cashier. Talk about how the money has bought the thing after you leave the store. When your child understands the basic function of money, you can start explaining more complex ways of using money.
